title: Paris Olympics' Club France is 'the place to be' for supporters, athletes and ever-present sponsors
summary: The venue, located at La Villette in Paris, can accommodate 25,000 people at any one time, including 5,000 inside and 20,000 on the adjacent lawns. By the middle of the week, it was welcoming between 39,000 and 40,000 people a day.

title: Mondo Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record with second gold at Olympics
summary: The 24-year-old cleared 6.25 meters on Monday night with his second straight gold medal performance.

title: France beats Egypt 3-1, faces Spain in men's soccer final at Paris Olympics
summary: France, looking for their second Olympic men's football gold medal and first since 1984, now face Spain in the final at the Parc des Princes in Paris on Friday.

title: Basketball at the 2024 Olympics: The French team still searching for the right balance as the quarter-finals get underway
summary: Les Bleus face Canada in the quarter-finals on Tuesday against a backdrop of disagreements between certain players and staff over strategic options.

title: Prime Minister forced to flee Bangladesh by helicopter
summary: A crackdown on demonstrators left around 100 people dead on Sunday. The army announced the formation of an interim government.

title: Israeli prisons 'operate like torture camps' for Palestinian detainees
summary: A report by the human rights organization B'Tselem has denounced the 'widespread, systematic and prolonged commission of the crime of torture' by the Netanyahu government.

title: Gymnastics at the 2024 Olympics: Simone Biles denied gold on beam and floor
summary: The American gymnast's fall benefited Italy's Alice D'Amato, who won the Olympic beam title. On floor, Brazil's Rebeca Andrade won by a margin of 0.33 points.

title: Paris Olympics: Russia's absence has benefited no single country
summary: At the Tokyo Olympics, Russia won 71 medals, 20 of them gold. As the second week of the Paris Games gets underway, no delegation has largely profited from these undefended medals.

title: Rockets launched at base hosting US troops in Iraq, Biden holds crisis talks to avoid all-out war in Middle East
summary: President Joe Biden held crisis talks on Monday on a potential Iranian counterattack on Israel as his administration said it was working around the clock to avoid all-out war in the Middle East.

title: In Tunisia, the president Kais Saied buries the gains of the democratic transition a little more deeply
summary: The detention of Sihem Bensedrine, human rights activist and former president of the Truth & Dignity Commission, is a further blow to the regime's opponents.

title: Paris Olympics: Léon Marchand has swept France off its feet
summary: With four Olympic gold medals in as many individual events and a bronze medal in the relay to round off his marathon of 14 races in one week, the 22-year-old swimmer is already one of the heroes of these Games.

title: For the Olympics, the former Paris stock exchange hosts a VIP American sports bar
summary: The American Olympic Committee has set up its Team USA House in the  Palais Brongniart, the former headquarters of the Paris stock exchange. Admission costs €325 plus tax.

title: Middle East braces for Iran and its allies' retaliation
summary: Iran and its allies have stepped up their threats against Israel following the targeted assassination in Tehran of Ismail Haniyeh, head of the Hamas political bureau. The US announced that it was stepping up its military presence in the region.

title: Paris Olympics: The 'Africa Station' fan zone knows how to party
summary: The venue, located at the Robert-César stadium on the banks of the Seine, has brought together a Club 2024 and a cultural space for the continent's fifty-three delegations. Local residents flock to the site.

title: In Venezuela, 'Nicolas Maduro's only strategy at the moment is to hold on to power'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Venezuelan political scientist Colette Capriles says the 'democratic transition in Venezuela requires dialogue between all the political forces.'

title: Paris Olympics: Noah Lyles wins 100 m on photo finish for first Olympic title
summary: The 27-year-old sprinter beat Jamaica's Kishane Thompson and fellow American Fred Kerley. The US hadn't won the title since the 2004 Athens Games.

title: Paris 2024: Artistic swimming is open to men, but will take place without them
summary: For the first time in the history of the Olympic Games, the artistic swimming team events are officially mixed-gender. However, none of the 10 nations competing in them has male swimmers on its team.

title: Olympic pole vaulters, an unusual brotherhood united by a touch of madness
summary: The discipline, both dangerous and spectacular, represents a unique microcosm in the world of athletics. Its practitioners praise the 'great solidarity' fostered by the nature of the competitions.

title: Paris Olympics: Safe zones set up to combat sexual and gender-based violence
summary: Prevention and reception spaces for victims and witnesses have been created in areas of festivities. These include 'safe zones,' an idea borrowed from music festivals, set up at La Villette and Hôtel de Ville, where around 10 cases have been handled since July 20.

title: France's Kauli Vaast wins Olympic gold in men's surfing
summary: All winners of the Paris Olympics surfing competition, held on the French Polynesian Island of Tahiti, are first-time Olympic medalists.

title: Paris Olympics: The gender-specific rules that regulate athletes's uniforms
summary: Federations, equipment manufacturers and social norms restrict female athletes' clothing choices. While equality is making headway in some sports, specific regulations persist in major disciplines such as gymnastics and athletics.

title: Military in control of Bangladesh after Hasina flees, resigns
summary: Sheikh Hasina, 76, had been in power since 2009 but was accused of rigging elections in January. Millions of people have taken to the streets over the past month demanding she step down. Hundreds have died as security forces sought to quell the unrest.

title: Google maintains illegal monopoly over internet search, US judge rules
summary: The American giant, found guilty of imposing its search software on devices by default, has announced its intention to appeal the Monday ruling.

title: Understanding the tensions between Hezbollah and Israel in five key dates
summary: Tensions between the Lebanese Shiite movement and Israel have existed over the past 40 years, and were rekindled in recent months following the Hamas attack on October 7 and Israel's war in Gaza.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: At 'half-time,' France has already reaped a historic medal collection
summary: After nine days of competition, the French delegation has already won 43 medals, more than in any post-war Olympic Games.

title: UK's Prime Minister Starmer experiences first major crisis with far-right riots
summary: The Labour government, which has been in office for four weeks, is facing a difficult battle against online disinformation, particularly on X, where fake news has proliferated since Elon Musk's takeover of the network.

title: Paris 2024: Armand Duplantis eclipses competitors with gold medal and new world record
summary: The insatiable Swedish champion won his second consecutive Olympic title on Monday and set a ninth world record with a 6.25m jump.

title: A week into the Olympics, 'France seems to have taken a vacation from itself'
summary: While the opening ceremony continues to draw criticism from conservatives, many countries are hailing the 'collective ecstasy' this edition of the Olympics is generating around the world.

title: US presidential election: Kamala Harris on the sidelines of identity politics
summary: The likely Democratic candidate is to launch her campaign on Tuesday in Philadelphia by introducing her running mate. Born to a mother from India and a father from Jamaica, she avoids defining herself by her origins.

title: The UK underestimates the influence of the far right
summary: Over the past week, England and Northern Ireland have been rocked by an outbreak of nationalist, anti-Muslim and xenophobic violence. These riots painfully raise the question of the influence of the racist and anti-Muslim movement in the country.

title: Bangladesh plunges into unknown after departure of 'Iron Lady'
summary: Thousands of people took to the streets, bursting with joy, after the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who had been in power for 15 years. Yet the period that lies ahead gives rise to as many fears as hopes.

title: UN confirms possible involvement of nine UNRWA employees in October 7 attack
summary: However, an internal UN investigation has cleared nine other employees of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees, accused by Israel of involvement in the Hamas assault on its territory.

title: Le Monde's Paris Olympics guide. Day 12: A tribute to women athletes
summary: Need a hand navigating the Olympics? Whether you're in the French capital for the sport, the culture or the food, Le Monde's English edition has got you covered with a handy guide full of practical information and secret tips.

title: Tim Walz reportedly picked to be Kamala Harris's running mate
summary: The governor of Minnesota brings a rural Midwestern perspective to the Democrat's campaign while also having notched liberal policy goals such as cannabis legalization and increasing worker protections.

title: Paris 2024: Surfers Kauli Vaast and Johanne Defay are hot Olympic stuff
summary: The French surfing team shone on the Teahupo'o waves on Monday, winning two medals. Local lad Kauli Vaast clinched the gold, while Johanne Defay of La Réunion island won the bronze.

title: Chinese diving prodigy wins third Olympic gold at age 17
summary: Quan Hongchan secured her second gold at the Paris Olympics and third of her career to maintain China's perfect record in the sport in the French capital.

title: Nigeria arrests over 90 protesters with Russian flags
summary: As thousands of Nigerians have come out in protest against government policies and the high cost of living, the country's security chiefs have railed against those carrying Russian flags, seen as 'crossing the red line.'

title: Air France and Transavia maintain suspending flights to Beirut
summary: The airline companies had suspended flights to Beirut on July 29, after Israel warned it would retaliate for Lebanese rocket fire. Customers with affected reservations could postpone or cancel their trips free of charge.

title: Whether viewership or terabits, the Paris Olympic Games are breaking records
summary: Whether live or pre-recorded, on the living room TV or a smartphone in the street, the Olympic events have generated record viewership figures for TV channels and telecommunications operators alike.

title: Somalia police confiscate and burn hundreds of face veils
summary: The authorities in the southern state of Jubaland imposed a ban on the niqab in the port city of Kismayo in 2021 for security reasons. But officers said the edict had not been comprehensively followed.

title: Kamala Harris chooses Tim Walz as running mate in hope of winning over Great Lakes region voters
summary: The likely Democratic presidential candidate's running mate is governor of Minnesota.

title: Nasrallah says Hezbollah and Iran are 'obliged to respond' to Israel after Haniyeh and Shukr killings
summary: In a speech, Hezbollah's chief said 'whatever the consequences,' a response was necessary after the killings last week of Hezbollah military commander Fuad Shukr and Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh.

title: Eight museums and foundations to visit away from the crowds during the Olympics
summary: While many eyes are focused on the Games, museums in Paris, deprived of some of their tourist traffic, offer optimal visiting conditions.

title: Paris 2024: France sink Canada to secure Germany rematch in Olympic basketball
summary: Guerschon Yabusele and Isaia Cordinier picked up the slack for a subdued Victor Wembanyama, with France winning 82-73.

title: Yunus to lead Bangladesh interim government
summary: Nobel-winning microfinance pioneer Muhammad Yunus has been tapped to lead an interim government after the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Hamas names Gaza chief Yahya Sinwar as new political leader
summary: Ismail Haniyeh, Sinwar's predecessor, was killed in Tehran last week, sending regional tensions soaring.
